alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Prince George; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Prince George, northern Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie and northwestern Surry Counties and the southeastern City of Petersburg through 430 PM EDT... At 327 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Disputanta, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could produce localized ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Waverly, Disputanta, Sussex, Stony Creek, Homeville, Burrowsville, Cabin Point, Carson, Newville, Booker, Reams, Barham, Littleton, New Bohemia, Richard Bland College, Templeton, Prince George Golf, Oak Hill Corner and Huske. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
